name: Aethermoor Harbor Skirmish
prompt: heroic tabletop fantasy (D&D 5e adjacent), grounded medieval-fantasy materials, culturally coherent gear, no modern tech or signage, consistent painterly collection style, Top-down tactical map: Aethermoor Harbor Skirmish, 15x15 squares at 140 px per square (140 DPI), 15x15, distinct patterns for passable / impassable / difficult, collapses, rips, currents; marked clearly, multiple routes and flanking options, ramps, stairs, ledges, or contour lines, bold lines for walls/obstacles; fine lines for textures; high-contrast grid, icons only; no text labels; VTT-ready export, skyward romantic realism, cloudstone and brass, wind-swept forms, airship motifs, palette: navy, gold, cloud-white, warm sun highlights, Use specified aspect/resolution; avoid artifacts., No embedded text labels; use icons and clear linework only. Reserve clean margins and text-safe areas for VTT overlays. Render grid and numeric ticks crisply; avoid stylized fonts entirely., Avoid garbled or random letter strings; keep any symbols meaningful or use numbered pins., Avoid sci-fi UIs, modern signage, photoreal CGI, anime style, bloom glare.
alt_text: Top-down tactical map of Aethermoor Harbor Skirmish.
revised_prompt: Render a tactical map of a fantastical harbor named Aethermoor, presented from a top-down perspective in a style reminiscent of a rich, painterly medieval fantasy. The 15x15 grid should be 140 px per square, totaling a map size of 2100x2100 px, and should clearly portray different terrain types - passable, impassable, and places with difficult terrain. Please incorporate signs of weathering such as collapses, rips, and currents with clarity. Ensure the map provides multiple routes and strategic options, including features like ramps, stairs, ledges, and contour lines. Embellish walls and obstacles with bold lines, while using fine lines to represent textures. The grid should be high-contrast yet crisply rendered. The palette should incorporate shades of navy, gold, and cloud-white, complemented by warm sun highlights. It's a fantastical world that draws inspiration from grounded medieval materials, featuring culturally coherent gear and devoid of any modern tech or sci-fi UIs. The aesthetic should lean towards a blend of wind-swept forms and airship motifs, evoking a sense of skyward romantic realism. Lastly, this map should be ready for Virtual Tabletop (VTT) use - void of embedded text labels, stylized fonts, and garbled symbols, reserving clean margins and text-safe areas for overlays. Instead, icons and clear linework should be used to denote features, with a focus on avoiding random letter strings and modern signage.
